meanings.sent1: The moste delicious cake I ever tasted was at the party.
meanings.sent2: She is the moste talented singer in the school choir.
meanings.sent3: Eating the moste ice cream in one sitting is a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was the moste radiant light in the room.
meanings.sent5: The moste beautiful sunset painted the sky in vibrant colors.

meanings.definition: Used to emphasize a superlative adjective or adverb
meanings.sent1: He ran the moste quickly to catch the bus.
meanings.sent2: She sings the moste beautifully of all the performers.
meanings.sent3: The cat slept the moste peacefully on the cozy blanket.
meanings.sent4: The stars shone the moste brightly in the clear night sky.
meanings.sent5: The flowers smelled the moste fragrantly in the garden.

meanings.sent1: The moste challenging part of the puzzle was the last piece.
meanings.sent2: It was the moste exciting movie I have ever watched.
meanings.sent3: The moste surprising thing happened when the dog started talking.
meanings.sent4: His speech was the moste inspiring moment of the event.
meanings.sent5: The moste intense storm hit the town with strong winds and heavy rain.
